{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient delivered a baby with normal expulsion of an intact placenta, but started bleeding vaginally 30 minutes later. On examination, she was hypotensive and had a boggy mass palpated on her abdomen. USG showed retained placental tissues. This suggests that there is incomplete separation of the placenta from the uterus. Placenta accreta is the most likely diagnosis as it is characterized by abnormal placentation where the placenta grows into the myometrium, leading to retention of the placenta after delivery.", "answer_choice": C}
